wizard.synopsis: Despite that wonderful, whimsical name, wizards are not really a special form of user interface, and they have only a particular range of utility. Wizards are used to perform multi-step tasks.

task-dialog.synopsis: A dialog box that can be used to display information and receive simple input from the user. Like a message box, it is formatted by the operating system according to parameters you set. However, a task dialog has many more features than a message box.

spyder.synopsis: A free and open source scientific environment written in Python, for Python, and designed by and for scientists, engineers and data analysts. It features a unique combination of the advanced editing, analysis, debugging, and profiling functionality of a comprehensive development tool with the data exploration, interactive execution, deep inspection, and beautiful visualization capabilities of a scientific package.

apache2.synopsis: A free and open-source cross-platform web server software.

bash.synopsis: A shell program and command language supported by the <abbr title="Free Software Foundation">FSF</abbr> and first developed for the <abbr title="GNU is Not Unix">GNU</abbr> Project by Brian Fox.

blender.synopsis: Blender is a free and open-source 3D computer graphics software tool set.

c.synopsis: A general-purpose programming language. It was created in the 1970s by Dennis Ritchie and Ken Thompson. Despite its age, it remains very widely used and influential.

chartier--le-goff-marius.synopsis: Marius Chartier--Le Goff est né en <time datetime="2005">2005</time> et est étudiant en BUT informatique à l'IUT de Lannion. Il souhaite continuer ses études jusqu'au titre d'ingénieur.

cities-skylines.synopsis: A <time datetime="2015">2015</time> city-building game developed by Colossal Order and published by Paradox Interactive. The game is a single-player open-ended city-building simulation.

cpp.synopsis: A high-level, general-purpose programming language created by Danish computer scientist Bjarne Stroustrup.

csharp.synopsis: A general-purpose high-level programming language supporting multiple paradigms.

css.synopsis: A style sheet language used for specifying the presentation and styling of a document written in a markup language such as HTML or XML.

csv.synopsis: A text file format that uses commas to separate values, and newlines to separate records.

docker.synopsis: A set of platform as a service (PaaS) products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.

dotnet.synopsis: A free and open-source, managed computer software framework for Windows, Linux, and macOS operating systems.

doxygen.synopsis: A documentation generator and static analysis tool for software source trees. When used as a documentation generator, Doxygen extracts information from specially-formatted comments within the code. When used for analysis, Doxygen uses its parse tree to generate diagrams and charts of the code structure. Doxygen can cross reference documentation and code, so that the reader of a document can easily refer to the actual code.

ebnf.synopsis: A <abbr title="Backus-Naur Form">BNF</abbr> extension created by Niklaus Wirth in 1996. This language expresses formal grammars, which are notably used in compiler design.

figma.synopsis: A collaborative web application for interface design.

github.synopsis: A developer platform that allows developers to create, store, manage and share their code.

gloomaps.synopsis: A simple online visual sitemap tool.

html.synopsis: The standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser. It defines the content and structure of web content.

inno-setup.synopsis: A free software script-driven installation system created in Delphi by Jordan Russell. The first version was released in 1997.

java.synopsis: A high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

javascript.synopsis: A programming language and core technology of the Web, alongside HTML and CSS.

json.synopsis: An open standard file format and data interchange format that uses human-readable text to store and transmit data objects consisting of attribute–value pairs and arrays (or other serializable values).

kervadec-matteo.synopsis: Mattéo Kervadec est un étudiant en 1ère année de BUT en filière Informatique à l'IUT de Lannion. Il a un baccalauréat avec les spécialités Mathématiques et NSI obtenu au lycée Sainte-Anne à Sainte-Anne-d'Auray. Il est passionné par le tennis et le cinéma autant dans les films que le jeu vidéo. Il porte aussi un intérêt pour le développement de logiciels informatiques.

lua.synopsis: A lightweight, high-level, multi-paradigm programming language designed primarily for embedded use in applications.

markdown.synopsis: A lightweight markup language for creating formatted text using a plain-text editor.

minecraft.synopsis: A <time datetime="2011">2011</time> sandbox game developed by Mojang Studios and originally released in <time datetime="2009">2009</time>.

mysql.synopsis: An open-source relational database management system.

pascal.synopsis: An imperative and procedural programming language, designed by Niklaus Wirth as a small, efficient language intended to encourage good programming practices using structured programming and data structuring.

pgsql.synopsis: A free and open-source relational database management system.

php.synopsis: A general-purpose scripting language geared towards web development, created in 1993.

powershell.synopsis: A task automation and configuration management program from Microsoft, consisting of a command-line shell and the associated scripting language.

python.synopsis: A high-level, general-purpose programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability with the use of significant indentation.

replit.synopsis: An American start-up and an online IDE that allows creating online programming projects called repls.

rolland-stanislas.synopsis: Stanislas Rolland est âgé de 18 ans et est actuellement en première année de BUT informatique à l'IUT de Lannion. Avant de rejoindre cette formation, il a obtenu son baccalauréat mention assez bien avec les spécialités Mathématiques et NSI.

sass.synopsis: A preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into CSS.

scheme.synopsis: A dialect of the Lisp family of programming languages. Scheme was created during the 1970s at the <abbr title="MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory">MIT AI</abbr> Lab).

smalltalk.synopsis: A purely object oriented programming language (OOP) that was originally created in <time datetime="1972">1972</time> for educational use.

sql.synopsis: A domain-specific language used to manage data, especially in relational database management systems.

sql-workbench.synopsis: A database engine written in the C programming language.

sqlite.synopsis: A DBMS-independent, cross-platform SQL query tool.

svg.synopsis: An XML-based vector image format for defining two-dimensional graphics, having support for interactivity and animation.

tkinter.synopsis: A Python binding to the Tk GUI toolkit. It is the standard Python interface to the Tk GUI toolkit.

toe-paolo.synopsis: Paolo Vito Toé est un étudiant en BUT Informatique à l'IUT de Lannion. Son parcours le pousse à s'améliorer en permanence, car l'informatique est une de ses grandes passions. Né aux États-Unis et ayant grandi dans plusieurs pays différents, il est suis aussi passionné par les cultures étrangères. Outre ses études, il est passionné par la lecture et la création de jeux.

visual-paradigm.synopsis: A versatile software development tool that provides a range of features to support different aspects of software development life cycle (SDLC). It's primarily known for its UML (Unified Modeling Language) modeling tools, which help developers, architects, and analysts to visualize, specify, construct, and document software systems.

visual-studio.synopsis: An <abbr title="Integrated Development Environment">IDE</abbr> developed by Microsoft. It is used to develop computer programs.

vs-code.synopsis: A source-code editor developed by Microsoft for Windows, Linux, macOS and web browsers.

winforms.synopsis: A free and open-source graphical class library included as a part of Microsoft .NET, .NET Framework or Mono.

wpf.synopsis: A free and open-source user interface framework for Windows-based desktop applications.

xml.synopsis: A markup language and file format for storing, transmitting, and reconstructing arbitrary data.

zig.synopsis: An imperative, general-purpose, statically typed, compiled system programming language designed by Andrew Kelley in <time datetime="2015">2015</time> as a successor to C.
